de.affect.compute

Interface DecayFunction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExponentialDecayFunction, LinearDecayFunction, TangensHyperbolicusDecayFunction

    public interface DecayFunction
    Interface for emotion decay functions
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Patrick Gebhard

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Emotion decay(Emotion emotion)
      Decays an emotion and returns the result.
      int decaySteps()
      Access the amount of decay steps.
      double getConfigParameter()
      Returns (if any) the additional configuration parameter
      boolean hasConfigParameter()
      Indicates if function has additional configuration parameter
      void init(int decaySteps)
      Initializes the decay function.
      void setConfigParameter(double param)
      Sets the additional configuration parameter

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(int decaySteps)
        Initializes the decay function. The decay function computes for each emotion in the emotion vector a decay factor based on the number of steps required to decay to the emotion baseline.
        Parameters:
        decaySteps - the number of steps to decay
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the set of emotions is not specified
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of decay steps is not positive
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the decay threshold is negative

      • decay

        Emotion decay(Emotion emotion)
        Decays an emotion and returns the result. The intensity of an emotion is always greater or equal to the emotion baseline.
        Parameters:
        emotion - the emotion to decay
        Returns:
        the decayed emotion

      • decaySteps

        int decaySteps()
        Access the amount of decay steps.
        Returns:
        the number of steps to decay.

      • hasConfigParameter

        boolean hasConfigParameter()
        Indicates if function has additional configuration parameter
        Returns:
        existance of additional configuration parameter (true or false)

      • getConfigParameter

        double getConfigParameter()
        Returns (if any) the additional configuration parameter
        Returns:
        if exisits, additional configuration parameter, else -1.0d

      • setConfigParameter

        void setConfigParameter(double param)
        Sets the additional configuration parameter
